name: rs_engine_webgpu
description: A cross-platform WebGPU triangle rendering application with both native (Dawn) and web (Emscripten) versions.

scripts.dev:simple: npm run build && npm run preview
scripts.build:web: emcmake cmake -S . -B build_web -DBUILD_WEB=ON && cmake --build build_web --target viewer
scripts.build:web:fluid: emcmake cmake -S . -B build_web -DBUILD_WEB=ON && cmake --build build_web --target fluid_demo
scripts.preview:fluid: ./scripts/kill-port.sh 3378 && cd build_web/apps/fluid_demo && echo 'üåä Fluid Demo running at http://localhost:3378' && python3 -m http.server 3378
scripts.dev:fluid: npm run build:web:fluid && npm run preview:fluid
scripts.copy-html: cp apps/viewer/index.html build_web/apps/viewer/index.html && echo '‚úÖ HTML file updated'
scripts.preview: ./scripts/kill-port.sh 3377 && cd build_web/apps/viewer && echo 'üåç Viewer running at http://localhost:3377' && python3 -m http.server 3377
scripts.preview:all: npm run preview & npm run preview:fluid
scripts.test:web: npm run build:web && echo '‚úÖ Web build test passed'
scripts.help:
echo 'üöÄ Available commands:
  npm run dev:fluid      - Build and serve fluid demo (port 3378)
  npm run preview        - Serve viewer (port 3377)
  npm run preview:fluid  - Serve fluid demo (port 3378)
  npm run preview:all    - Serve both apps simultaneously
  npm run build:web:fluid - Build fluid demo for web
  npm run kill-server    - Kill servers on both ports (3377, 3378)
  npm run dev            - Start development with auto-reload
  npm run build          - Build web version
  npm run copy-html      - Quick HTML update
  npm run kill-port [PORT] - Kill server on specific port
  npm run native         - Run native application (Unix/macOS)
  npm run native:windows - Run native application (Windows PowerShell)
  npm run native:win     - Run native application (Windows Batch)
  npm run build:dawn:windows - Build Dawn library (Windows PowerShell)
  npm run build:dawn:win - Build Dawn library (Windows Batch)
  npm run clean          - Clean all builds'
